alert.note: Alert for Covington; Lamar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 17 at 6:30PM CDT until April 17 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COVINGTON AND NORTH CENTRAL LAMAR COUNTIES... At 630 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sanford, or 9 miles south of Collins, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Covington and north central Lamar Counties, including the following locations... Seminary. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
